result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CHAD D. SLOAN

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Defendant CHAD D. SLOAN in court.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for CHAD D. SLOAN.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gasparek moves to adjourn plea/sentencing hearing approximately 30 days.  No objection by State.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:41 AM  Prosecuting attorney David C. Rashid in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHAD D. SLOAN in court, in custody.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for CHAD D. SLOAN. Complaint on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
forwarded to Winnebago County Sheriff's Office - Transport Division to process by CA

Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHAD D. SLOAN not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for CHAD D. SLOAN. Issues with video with Calumet County.  Reschedule FP date and have DA prepare a writ for Calumet County Jail.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHAD D. SLOAN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer appeared by video for CHAD D. SLOAN. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. Advised of rights. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Record closed @ 250
